content.description: Workers at a warehouse of consumer goods gather items from the warehouse to fill customer orders. The number of items in a sample of orders and the time, in minutes, it took the workers to gather the items were recorded. A scatterplot of the recorded data showed a curved pattern, and the square root of the number of items was taken to create a linear pattern. The following table shows computer output from the least-squares regression analysis created to predict the time it takes to gather items from the number of items in an order.
content.question: Predictor <math alttext="Coefficient" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mrow><mi>C</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> Constant 3.0979 Square root of items 2.7633 <math alttext="R squared equals, 96.7 percent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>R-Sq</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>96.7</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> Based on the regression output, which of the following is the predicted time, in minutes, that it took to gather the items if the order has 22 items?

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
